metadata.title: CVE-2020-2732 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was discovered in the way that the KVM hypervisor handledinstruction emulation for an L2 guest when nested virtualisation isenabled. Under some circumstances, an L2 guest may trick the L0 guest intoaccessing sensitive L1 resources that should be inaccessible to the L2guest.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-2732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-42-generic - 5.3.0-42.34~18.04.1
linux-image-5.3.0-42-generic-lpae - 5.3.0-42.34~18.04.1
